content.heading: Christian Ministry for College Students
content.body: LA UBF (Los Angeles University Bible Fellowship) is an international, non-denominational evangelical church. We serve college students from diverse backgrounds, helping them to grow in faith, build community, and find purpose through the Word of God.

pages.title: About
pages.metaDescription: Learn about LA UBF — our mission, values, and community of faith on college campuses across Los Angeles.

content.description: Our main focus is to study the Bible and grow in the grace and knowledge of Jesus Christ as his disciples.

content.heading: About UBF
content.description: University Bible Fellowship (UBF) is an international evangelical church (non-denominational) dedicated to Christ and his kingdom. Our main focus is to study the Bible, grow in the grace and knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ, and live according to his teachings as his disciples. We especially pray to reach college students and help them grow as his lifelong disciples. Our goal is to obey our Lord’s commands to love one another and to go and make disciples of all nations (Jn 13:34; Mt 28:18-20). We pray that God may continue to call and raise lay missionaries through us and send them to the ends of the earth (Ac 1:8).

items.title: Bible Study
items.description: We help students study the Bible so they may come to know God personally, understand themselves, and find purpose in Jesus Christ. Bible studies are offered one-to-one with a mentor or in small groups centered around campuses and shared interests.

items.title: Discipleship
items.description: We walk with students as they grow as disciples of Jesus through shared life and discipleship training. Our goal is to equip students to mature in faith and become disciple makers who help others follow Christ.

items.title: Fellowship
items.description: Fellowship is an essential part of our faith as we support and encourage one another in community. We share fellowship through Sunday worship, activities, and retreats as we grow together in Christ.

paragraphs.text: there is one God in three Persons: God the Father, God the Son, and God the Holy Spirit.

God created the heavens and the earth and all other things in the universe; that He is the Sovereign Ruler of all things; that the Sovereign God reveals Himself; we believe in his redemptive work and in his final judgment.
the Bible is inspired by God; that it is the truth; that it is the final authority in faith and practice.
since the fall of Adam, all people have been under the bondage and power of sin and are deserving of the judgment and wrath of God.

Jesus Christ, who is God and man, through his atoning, sacrificial death on the cross for our sins and his resurrection, is the only way of salvation; he alone saves us from sin and judgment and purifies us from the contamination of the world caused by sin

pages.title: Ministries
pages.metaDescription: Explore LA UBF ministries — campus, college, young adult, high school, and children's programs.

content.description: At LA UBF, we believe that spiritual growth happens best in community. Whether you are a student, a working professional, or a parent, there is a place for you here.

items.title: Young Adults
items.description: A community of college students and young professionals growing together through campus Bible studies, fellowship, and shared worship.

items.title: Adults
items.description: Adults from many walks of life—campus leaders, Bible teachers, parents, and missionaries—growing in faith through personal and group Bible study, conferences, and outreach.

items.title:
Middle & High School
(HBF / JBF)
items.description: Our youth ministries for middle and high school students, with engaging Bible studies, fun fellowship activities, and a supportive community during these formative years.

items.title: Children (CBF)
items.description: A safe, engaging, and age-appropriate environment where children can learn about God’s Word and build friendships while growing in faith.

content.heading: Join a Campus Ministry
content.description: We have bible study clubs all across different college campuses. Join us for weekly group bible studies and get to know each other through fellowship.

content.heading: Are you a newcomer?
content.description: We know that visiting a new church can be intimidating. Learn more about our church and how you can take your next steps at LA UBF.

pages.title: College Ministry
pages.metaDescription: LA UBF college ministry — Bible study, fellowship, and discipleship for university students.

heroImage.alt: Young adult and college ministry group

content.heading: Young Adult Ministry (YAM)
content.description: The Young Adult Ministry (YAM) at LA UBF is a vibrant community of college students and young professionals growing together in faith. Through campus Bible study groups, fellowship activities, and shared worship, we create a space where young adults can explore God’s Word, build meaningful friendships, and discover their calling. Whether you’re on campus or in the workforce, you’ll find a welcoming community here.

items.title: Fellowship
items.description: Our young adult fellowship is a space to build authentic friendships and grow together. From shared meals to group outings, we create opportunities for meaningful connection and community among college students and young professionals.

items.title: Discipleship Training
items.description: Through personal and group Bible study, we help young adults develop a strong foundation in God’s Word. Our discipleship training equips students to grow as leaders, mentors, and faithful followers of Christ.

items.title: Serving Opportunities
items.description: We believe in learning by serving. Young adults have the opportunity to serve through campus outreach, community events, conferences, and supporting the church’s mission locally and beyond.

content.heading: Join a Campus Ministry
content.description: We have Bible study groups meeting on campuses across Southern California. Find a group near you and start studying the Bible with fellow students.

content.heading: Are you a newcomer?
content.description: We know that visiting a new church can be intimidating. Learn more about our church and how you can take your next steps at LA UBF.

pages.title: Adults Ministry
pages.metaDescription: LA UBF young adults ministry — community and spiritual growth for young professionals.

content.heading: Adult Ministry
content.description: Our adult ministry brings together people from many walks of life, including campus leaders, Bible teachers, parents, missionaries, and members growing in faith. Within the adult ministry, there are opportunities for personal and group Bible study, special conferences, campus outreach, and opportunities to support the church’s mission in various mission fields and beyond. Join us for Sunday worship to learn more about how you can find your place at LA UBF.

items.title: Growing in Faith
items.description: Adult ministry includes opportunities for Bible study, prayer, and spiritual growth to be built up and be established in God’s grace, devotionals, and shared learning, adults grow together in the Word.

items.title: Raising Disciples
items.description: Many adults learn to grow in leadership, mentoring, teaching personal Bible studies, or guiding others in faith. Teaching helps to grow in understanding by sharing God’s Word with others. Key to our ministry is raising others as lifelong disciples of Christ.

items.title: Serving & Mission
items.description: Adults take part and serve together through short-term and long-term service opportunities, seasonal conferences, campus outreach, and opportunities to support the church’s mission in various mission fields and beyond.

items.title: Community & Fellowship
items.description: Adult ministry is also a place to build relationships through simple shared meals as a church, joyful worship, time spent together at various studies, and fellowship time together as a church community.

content.heading: Are you a newcomer?
content.description: We know that visiting a new church can be intimidating. Learn more about our church and how you can take your next steps at LA UBF.

pages.title: High School Ministry
pages.metaDescription: LA UBF high school ministry — faith, friendship, and Bible study for teens.

heroImage.alt: Middle and high school ministry group photo

content.heading: JBF & HBF
content.description: JBF (Junior Bible Fellowship) and HBF (High School Bible Fellowship) are our youth ministries for middle school and high school students. Through engaging Bible studies, fun fellowship activities, and a supportive community, we help young people build a strong foundation of faith during these formative years.

items.title: Praise Night
items.description: Praise Night is a time for our youth to come together in worship through music, prayer, and fellowship. It’s an uplifting experience where students can express their faith and grow closer to God and each other.

items.title: Fellowship
items.description: Fellowship activities give our youth the opportunity to build friendships, have fun, and strengthen their bonds within the church community through games, outings, and shared experiences.

items.title: Youth Conference
items.description: Our annual Youth Conference brings together students for an immersive experience of worship, Bible study, and community. It’s a highlight of the year where young people are inspired and challenged in their faith.

content.heading: Are you a newcomer?
content.description: We know that visiting a new church can be intimidating. Learn more about our church and how you can take your next steps at LA UBF.

pages.title: Children's Ministry
pages.metaDescription: LA UBF children's ministry — nurturing young hearts in faith and community.

content.heading: CBF
content.description: CBF (Children’s Bible Fellowship) is our ministry for children, where they can learn about God’s Word in a safe, engaging, and age-appropriate environment while building friendships and growing in faith.

items.title: Singspiration
items.description: Singspiration is a time for children to sing, dance, and share music’s simple joy. It helps them learn about God’s love through song, building worship skills early on.

items.title: Children’s Bible Class
items.description: In Children’s Bible Class, kids learn about the Bible through lessons designed to be fun, interactive, and easy to understand for their age.

items.title: Child Care During Sunday Service
items.description: We also offer child care during the Sunday worship service, providing a safe and engaging space for children so parents can attend the adult service with peace of mind.

content.heading: Are you a newcomer?
content.description: We know that visiting a new church can be intimidating. Learn more about our church and how you can take your next steps at LA UBF.

pages.title: I'm New
pages.metaDescription: New to LA UBF? Plan your visit, learn what to expect, and find ways to connect with our community.

content.heading: What is “UBF”?
content.description: University Bible Fellowship (UBF) is an international, non-denominational evangelical church centered on Bible study and discipleship. We especially serve college students, raising lifelong disciples of Jesus Christ who love one another and take part in God’s global mission.

content.heading: How to Get Started at LA UBF
content.description: We know visiting a new church can feel intimidating. We want to make your first experience as seamless and welcoming as possible. Here are the best ways to connect with our community.

cards.title: Join us on Sunday
cards.description: Experience our main worship service, gathered in fellowship to praise, study the Word, and grow in faith together through worship.

cards.title: Are you a College Student?
cards.description: Join one of our campus ministries to attend group Bible studies, connect with other students, and grow spiritually during college.

cards.title: Not sure where to start?
cards.description: Start with an upcoming event—an easy way to meet people and explore what LA UBF is all about at your own pace.

items.title: Bible Studies & Gathering
items.description: Personal Bible studies take place before worship. Let us know you’re interested and we’ll help you connect.

items.title: Worship Service
items.description: Join us for Sunday worship with a special song, a worship message, and praise together.

items.title: Lunch & Fellowship
items.description: Stay after service for lunch and fellowship, with food prepared by our community and time to connect.

content.heading: Join a Campus Ministry
content.description: We have bible study clubs all across different college campuses. Join us for weekly group bible studies and get to know each other through fellowship.

content.heading: Let us help you start
content.description: Let us know you’re coming and we’ll save a seat for you! We can also help match you with a Bible teacher or answer any questions about our ministries.
content.bibleTeacherLabel: I’d like to be matched with a personal bible teacher for bible studies or spiritual guidance
content.successMessage: Thank you! We’ve received your message and will get back to you soon.

items.question: Where and when do campus groups meet?
items.answer: Campus Bible study groups meet at various times throughout the week depending on the campus. Most groups meet once or twice a week. Fill out the contact form above and we’ll connect you with the group nearest to you.

items.question: What should I expect on my first Sunday visit?
items.answer: Our Sunday worship service is about 90 minutes and includes praise, prayer, and a sermon. Dress is casual—come as you are. You’re welcome to sit anywhere, and someone from our welcome team will be happy to help you get settled.

items.question: Do I need to know the Bible to attend?
items.answer: Not at all! Many of our members started with little or no Bible knowledge. Our studies are designed to be accessible to everyone, and our leaders are happy to walk alongside you at your own pace.

items.question: Is there parking available at the church?
items.answer: Yes, we have a free parking lot on-site. Street parking is also available on the surrounding blocks. If the lot is full, our parking team can help direct you.

items.question: How can I get connected beyond Sunday service?
items.answer: We’d love for you to join a small group Bible study, attend one of our fellowship events, or serve on a ministry team. Fill out the contact form on this page and we’ll help you find the best next step.

pages.title: Giving
pages.metaDescription: Support the mission of LA UBF through generous giving.
